alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 8:54PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 330 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM MDT, Heavy rain that occurred earlier in the Bighorns has resulted in the Little Goose Creek seeing a rapid rise in water, with a jump from 3.07 ft to 4.13 ft over the past 3 hours at its gauge located at Canyon. The Tongue River and Big Goose Creek are also beginning to see rises, just not as rapid. This will cause small stream flooding downstream as water will rapidly flow down the mountains. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier in the evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... The Little and Big Goose Creeks, Tongue River, and their associated tributaries within the advised area. Additional rainfall amounts up to half an inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rises in streams through Sheridan may occur overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan, Ranchester, Dayton and Big Horn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
